title: Toxic Player on Oce
body: After beating a LeBlanc in mid as katarina, being repeatedly told im "trash" and should "kill myself" at the beginning of and throughout the game. After we won the game, i was abused for 5 minutes non stop for being "trash" and told to "kill myself and hurry up doing it". They then went on their main account and abused me (and my friends) then deleted me. I cannot report their main account as i was versing their alt.

replies.body:
Did you report them after the game? If you forgot to, and have screenshots, submitting them to Riot Support @ https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us should get the person in trouble.

Just remember, they might not be instantly perma-banned due to punishment tiers. If they are already out of a 14 day ban and in bad standing, then they will be perma-banned, otherwise they will go up in tiers until they either reform or get banned. They will only skip steps due to extreme severity of what they say. Here are the punishment tiers:

* 10 game chat restriction
* 25 game chat restriction
* 14 day account ban
* Permanent account ban

League is all about resilience! Riot's also offered us a nice all chat disabler and team"mate" muter :)
Personally, I like to just play along, it makes it less of a one way entertainment show

there is a fix riot could implement. just like some other games do, if there is any toxic words or offensive phrases in a sentence that sentence does not go through and gets deleted
I did mute them, unfortunately it doesn't carry over to the post game lobby, however it was quite entertaining for me and the rest of her teammates haha

You should have taken screen shots and sent them to riot.

btw, if you did end up killing yourself that person can be held accountable for Manslaughter-Assisting suicide.
If you submit the chat logs to Riot Support you can report them that way.

report probably doesn't work at all. I've been experienced so many games with toxic players. and i did report but what happened after was, I met that toxic player again and he was being dirty again. However, I seriously doubt riot staffs did read those "SCREEN SHOTS" or not, because the ratio of joined a game with toxic players doesn't change, imo.

In my experience, reporting a toxic player merely gets them a five game chat limitation, which still allows them to message but caps at 5 messages and refills 1 message every few minutes i think. Basically a stern talking to, no real punishment
